A glimpse into the world of my #WIP, 𝗝𝗮𝗰𝗸 𝗼𝗳 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗿𝘁𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗼𝗺𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗤𝘂𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝗧𝗲𝗹𝗹𝘀 (𝗔𝗹𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁) 𝗔𝗹𝗹.
.
.
.
.
Day 11 of #writerfriendschallenge ... share an aesthetic for your story.
.
NOTE: I am skipping Days 8-10 and Day 12 of the challenge. As recompense for my crimes, 😉 🤭 I will add a little poem, from Jack's perspective.
.
"What Wounds"
.
It doesn't hurt --
much --
the shock wave,
the broken glass,
the inrushing water.
I expect them.
Welcome them.
.
What wounds --
far, far more --
is the tearing,
heart from heart;
flesh from flesh;
bone from bone.
I never imagined
YOU
would be the one
to break me.
.
Let me go.
These waters receive me,
since you will not.
.
.
.
.
.
~c. April Sauntry-James 2022 😘
.
#jackofheartsbook #betrayal #bookstagram #writingcommunity #writersofinstagram #brokenheartpoetry #brokenheartpoems

10 Facts about my #WIP (work in progress for you novices 😉). In order of obsessiveness.
.
1. Almost the entire novel is set in my adorable small town: Stillwater, Minnesota, USA.
2. Most of the events occur over three years...1988-1991.
3. I started writing the novel as backstory for a TV series I wrote first. Then it took on a life of its own and became a 500+ page behemoth. 🤷🏼‍♀️
4. I wrote the bulk of that massive manuscript in 3 months. No joke. Since then, I have been tweaking, fine-tuning, having it read, editing, and engaging in general foot dragging.
5. I listened to 80's / 90's pop songs while writing to get in the spirit of the book.
6. I have detailed timelines for each character, including things like their birthdays, first days of school, proms...and other secrets.
7. I drew up floor plans of all the significant characters' houses and exhaustively searched online images for similar houses and rooms.
8. The characters go to the "old" high school (now junior high) which was the location of the high school at that point in real-life history. I interviewed several former students of the school. I changed the name of the school, though, so I can create my own story for the school's future... and issue my own fake diplomas. 😆
9. I used historical daily temperature and weather records throughout the process of writing the novel so that the weather in the novel is historically accurate.
10. I may actually now own most of the significant furniture, costumes, and accessories mentioned in the book. I will leave you to imagine why... 😎
.
.
.
#jackofheartsbook #aprilsauntryjames #februarywriterswipchallenge #februarywriterswipchallenge2022 #tenfactsaboutmywip #WIP #amwriting

Jack of Hearts (and other parts) review !
•
Jack of Hearts is a fun, flirty, yet intense mystery ! It kept me so enthralled that i binge read it in a day because i was so addicted to the story and its characters. Whilst simultaneously being a mystery, it is open, honest, and oddly educational ! We get a confident character who knows who he is, and wants to help others feel the same, and being pushed into a box shows the effects on him heavily.
The story itself is fast paced and exciting, with a mix of drama, friendships, and sex, it felt almost real !
Speaking of sex, our world is usually divided into those who despise even the word and those who are open, and this book normalises the heck of sex and that’s so important for readers to learn today !
Overall i cannot wait for this book to be released for you all, so you can experience this amazing story also !
And thank you for @littlebrownyoungreaders for the copy !
•
•
•
